comment: Sign-in sheet every class; four exams, but there's a 8-10 page paper due at the end of the semester on one work of art; Tests are 20 question image identifications (year, medium, artist, title), about 20 difficult multiple choice questions, and an essay. He wants you to fail and thinks he's the smartest and best. PPT on D2L, only images, no notes.

He is so full of himself that he put himself in the lectures and on an exam. He passes around a sign-in sheet every class. There are only four exams, but there are also about four 1-2 page papers. His tests are 40 question image identifications. He shows the slides, and give you multiple choice answers on which artist produced it.

Professor Sach's tests are needlessly difficult. I like his lectures but his test scores dont accurately reflect what the students have learned. Our class's first test average? 40. He needs more realistic tests for non-art history majors. Unfortunately you'll probably have to take him.. make sure to leave him a bad KSU teacher review. Good luck.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Doctor Sachs is one of the best teachers I have had in my college career. He's very warm and welcoming, and always willing to help if you ask. He has 3 tests, no final, some art events you must attend, and 3 writing assignments. Strongly encouraged to go to lecture. The textbook can be a little disorganized.

Great professor. Made the class interesting by telling stories behind the paintings. 3 in class group assignments, some outside events and 3 test (no final). we didnt use the book much except for inclass assignments. attendence not mandatory but going to class make the test EXTREMELY easy. I only went to class and never studied and got a B.
Great teacher, multiple choice test plus 4 unknown artwork to identify. Study style of artist with textbook and listen to lectures ask questions and engage in class you will make an A.
